title: Russia controls Bakhmut, for now, but holding it will be difficult
description: Russia’s victory celebration may be brief, analysts said, with Bakhmut potentially following Kherson and other cities occupied by Russia only to be retaken by Ukraine.

title: Sudanese stuck in warzone after U.S. destroyed their passports
description: The decision angered people left stranded. France also destroyed passports, while staff at the Chinese Embassy moved to return them.

title: Mexican volcano spews ash and smoke as authorities urge caution
description: Popocatépetl, Mexico's second largest volcano, has been spewing ash onto an area accustomed to such rumblings, but authorities are telling them to be cautions.

title: Man living with mother’s decomposing remains sets fire to rescue workers
description: A hearing revealed the details of the May 11 case that resulted in dozens of injured police and rescue workers in the German city of Ratingen.

title: Why Buckingham Palace won’t return a ‘stolen’ Ethiopian prince’s remains
description: Ethiopian Prince Dejatch Alemayehu, a ward of Queen Victoria's, was buried at Windsor Castle after he died at 18. His descendants now want his remains back.

title: How Erdogan won Turkey’s earthquake-shattered south
description: In May 14 elections, across this devastated region — a traditional stronghold for Erdogan and his AKP party — voters stood firm in their support for him.

title: Rolf Harris, popular TV personality convicted of sex assaults, dies at 93
description: He enjoyed a 60-year career as a television presenter, songwriter and artist before his reputation was shattered.

title: Spies can’t work from home — and that’s hurting recruitment in Germany
description: It's tough to steal secrets in your pajamas. Germany's spy chief said his agency's work-from-home policy, lower wages and ban on personal cellphones put off young workers.

title: Anti-Putin militias mount cross-border incursion in western Russia
description: Ukraine denied any involvement in the attacks in Russia's Belgorod region, where the governor said one person was killed and eight were injured.

title: Court denies Prince Harry bid to hire police for his security
description: Harry travels with his own security, but he wanted to pay for specially-trained British police when in the country, which the Home Office denied.

title: In China’s words, it’s open for business. In actions, not so much.
description: China's commerce minister is expected to meet Biden administration officials and try to drum up business interest. That's a particularly hard sell right now.

title: A bomb in Afghanistan left him without legs. He just summited Everest.
description: Hari Budha Magar, a Gurkha veteran in the British army who lost both legs in Afghanistan, is the first above-the-knee double amputee to summit the mountain.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Fighting continues in and around Bakhmut, Ukrainian officials say
description: Despite Russia’s claim to have seized Bakhmut, Ukraine said it was in control of some areas. Before-and-after photos show flattened homes and scorched landscapes.

title: Europe’s hawkishness on China comes into focus
description: The leading voices on the continent expressing skepticism about China come from Europe's post-Soviet states.
